Andy Roddick practiced on the indoor hard court at Lawrence Joel Veterans Memorial Coliseum in Winston-Salem, N.C., yesterday and declared himself fit to compete in the Davis Cup quarterfinal match with Spain that begins tomorrow. Roddick, who strained his left hamstring March 28 in a match against Andy Murray at the Sony Ericsson Open in Key Biscayne, Fla., all but guaranteed he would play.

Roddick, No. 3 in the ATP rankings, and No. 9 James Blake are scheduled to play the singles matches, with the doubles team of Bob and Mike Bryan also preparing to play. The roster will be set today. Just in case, Patrick McEnroe, the United States captain, has Mardy Fish, ranked 22nd, and No. 67 Sam Querrey on hand.
